events.name: change
events.description: Emitted on lazy model value change (after user slides then releases thumb)

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
Size in CSS units, including unit name or standard size name (xs|sm|md|lg|xl)

Examples:
16px
2rem
xs
md

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
Model of the component; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

Examples:
:value="2"

attributes.name: max
attributes.description:
Number of icons to display

Examples:
3
:max="5"

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description:
Icon name following Quasar convention; make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix; If an array is provided each rating value will use the corresponding icon in the array (0 based)

Examples:
map
ion-add
img:https://cdn.quasar.dev/logo/svg/quasar-logo.svg
img:statics/path/to/some_image.png

attributes.name: icon-selected
attributes.description:
Icon name following Quasar convention to be used when selected (optional); make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix; If an array is provided each rating value will use the corresponding icon in the array (0 based)

Examples:
map
ion-add
img:https://cdn.quasar.dev/logo/svg/quasar-logo.svg
img:statics/path/to/some_image.png

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

Examples:
primary
teal-10

attributes.name: no-reset
attributes.description: When used, disables default behavior of clicking/tapping on icon which represents current model value to reset model to 0

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Put component in readonly mode

attributes.name: disable
attributes.description: Put component in disabled mode

events.name: input
events.description: Emitted when the component needs to change the model; Is also used by v-model

attributes.name: debounce
attributes.description:
Debounce amount (in milliseconds)

Examples:
0
530

events.name: resize
events.description: Parent element has resized (width or height changed)

attributes.name: thumb-style
attributes.description:
Object with CSS properties and values for styling the thumb of custom scrollbar

Examples:
:thumb-style="{ right: '4px', borderRadius: '5px', background: 'red', width: '10px', opacity: 1 }"

attributes.name: content-style
attributes.description:
Object with CSS properties and values for styling the container of QScrollArea

Examples:
:content-style="{ backgroundColor: '#C0C0C0' }"

attributes.name: content-active-style
attributes.description:
Object with CSS properties and values for styling the container of QScrollArea when scroll area becomes active (is mouse hovered)

Examples:
:content-active-style="{ backgroundColor: 'white' }"

attributes.name: visible
attributes.description: (Desktop only) Manually control the visibility of the scrollbar; Overrides default mouse over/leave behavior

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description:
When content changes, the scrollbar appears; this delay defines the amount of time (in milliseconds) before scrollbars disappear again (if component is not hovered)

Examples:
500
:delay="550"

attributes.name: horizontal
attributes.description: Register for horizontal scroll instead of vertical (which is default)

slots.name: default
slots.description: Default slot in the devland unslotted content of the component

attributes.name: debounce
attributes.description:
Debounce amount (in milliseconds)

Examples:
0
530

attributes.name: horizontal
attributes.description: Register for horizontal scroll instead of vertical (which is default)

events.name: scroll
events.description: Emitted when scroll position changes

attributes.name: virtual-scroll-horizontal
attributes.description: Make virtual list work in horizontal mode

attributes.name: virtual-scroll-slice-size
attributes.description:
Number of options to render in the virtual list

Examples:
:virtual-scroll-slice-size="60"

attributes.name: virtual-scroll-item-size
attributes.description:
Default size in pixels (height if vertical, width if horizontal) of an option; This value is used for rendering the initial list; Try to use a value close to the minimum size of an item

Examples:
:virtual-scroll-item-size="48"

attributes.name: virtual-scroll-sticky-size-start
attributes.description:
Size in pixels (height if vertical, width if horizontal) of the sticky part (if using one) at the start of the list; A correct value will improve scroll precision

Examples:
:virtual-scroll-sticky-size-start="48"

attributes.name: virtual-scroll-sticky-size-end
attributes.description:
Size in pixels (height if vertical, width if horizontal) of the sticky part (if using one) at the end of the list; A correct value will improve scroll precision

Examples:
:virtual-scroll-sticky-size-end="48"

attributes.name: error
attributes.description: Does field have validation errors?

attributes.name: error-message
attributes.description:
Validation error message (gets displayed only if 'error' is set to 'true')

Examples:
Username must have at least 5 characters

attributes.name: no-error-icon
attributes.description: Hide error icon when there is an error

attributes.name: rules
attributes.description:
Array of Functions/Strings; If String, then it must be a name of one of the embedded validation rules

Examples:
:rules="[ val => val.length <= 3 || 'Please use maximum 3 characters' ]"
:rules="[ 'fulltime' ]"

attributes.name: lazy-rules
attributes.description: Check validation status against the 'rules' only after field loses focus for first time

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
A text label that will float up above the input field, once the field gets focus

Examples:
Username

attributes.name: stack-label
attributes.description: Label will be always shown above the field regardless of field content (if any)

attributes.name: hint
attributes.description:
Helper (hint) text which gets placed below your wrapped form component

Examples:
Fill in between 3 and 12 characters

attributes.name: hide-hint
attributes.description: Hide the helper (hint) text when field doesn't have focus

attributes.name: prefix
attributes.description:
Prefix

Examples:
$

attributes.name: suffix
color
attributes.description:
Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

Examples:
primary
teal-10

attributes.name: bg-color
attributes.description:
Color name for component from the Quasar Color Palette

Examples:
primary
teal-10

attributes.name: dark
attributes.description: Notify the component that the background is a dark color

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Signals the user a process is in progress by displaying a spinner; Spinner can be customized by using the 'loading' slot.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: Appends clearable icon when a value (not undefined or null) is set; When clicked, model becomes null

attributes.name: clear-icon
attributes.description:
Custom icon to use for the clear button when using along with 'clearable' prop

Examples:
close

attributes.name: filled
attributes.description: Use 'filled' design for the field

attributes.name: outlined
attributes.description: Use 'outlined' design for the field

attributes.name: borderless
attributes.description: Use 'borderless' design for the field

attributes.name: standout
attributes.description:
Use 'standout' design for the field; Specifies classes to be applied when focused (overriding default ones)

Examples:
standout
standout="bg-primary text-white"

attributes.name: bottom-slots
attributes.description: Enables bottom slots ('error', 'hint', 'counter')

attributes.name: hide-bottom-space
attributes.description: Does not reserves space for hint/error/counter anymore when these are not used; as a result, it also disables the animation for those

attributes.name: counter
attributes.description: Show an automatic counter on bottom right

attributes.name: rounded
attributes.description: Applies a small standard border-radius for a squared shape of the component

attributes.name: square
attributes.description: Remove border-radius so borders are squared; Overrides 'rounded' prop

attributes.name: dense
attributes.description: Dense mode; occupies less space

attributes.name: items-aligned
attributes.description: Align content to match QItem

attributes.name: disable
attributes.description: Put component in disabled mode

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Put component in readonly mode

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Focus field on initial component render

attributes.name: for
attributes.description:
DOM element id to be used as 'for' attribute of the label and as 'id' for the focus target

Examples:
for="myFieldsId"

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
Model of the component; Must be Array if using 'multiple' prop; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

Examples:
v-model="myModel"

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Allow multiple selection; Model must be Array

attributes.name: display-value
attributes.description:
Override default selection string, if not using 'selected' slot/scoped slot and if not using 'use-chips' prop

Examples:
Options: x, y, z

attributes.name: display-value-sanitize
attributes.description: Force use of textContent instead of innerHTML to render selected option(s); Use it when the selected option(s) might be unsafe (from user input); Does NOT apply when using 'selected' or 'selected-item' slots!

attributes.name: options
attributes.description:
Available options that the user can select from. For best performance freeze the list of options.

Examples:
:options="[ 'BMW', 'Samsung Phone' ]"
:options="[ { label: 'BMW', value: 'car' }, { label: 'Samsung Phone', value: 'phone' } ]"

attributes.name: option-value
attributes.description:
Property of option which holds the 'value'; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
option-value="modelNumber"
:option-value="(item) => item === null ? null : item.modelNumber"

attributes.name: option-label
attributes.description:
Property of option which holds the 'label'; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
option-label="itemName"
:option-label="(item) => item === null ? 'Null value' : item.itemName"

attributes.name: option-disable
attributes.description:
Property of option which tells it's disabled; The value of the property must be a Boolean; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
option-disable="cannotSelect"
:option-disable="(item) => item === null ? true : item.cannotSelect"

attributes.name: hide-selected
attributes.description: Hides selection; Use the underlying input tag to hold the label (instead of showing it to the right of the input) of the selected option; Only works for non 'multiple' Selects

attributes.name: hide-dropdown-icon
attributes.description: Hides dropdown icon

attributes.name: dropdown-icon
attributes.description:
Icon name following Quasar convention; make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

Examples:
map
ion-add
img:https://cdn.quasar.dev/logo/svg/quasar-logo.svg
img:statics/path/to/some_image.png

attributes.name: max-values
attributes.description:
Allow a maximum number of selections that the user can do

Examples:
5

attributes.name: options-dense
attributes.description: Dense mode for options list; occupies less space

attributes.name: options-dark
attributes.description: Options menu will be colored with a dark color

attributes.name: options-selected-class
attributes.description:
CSS class name for options that are active/selected; Set it to an empty string to stop applying the default (which is text-* where * is the 'color' prop value)

Examples:
text-orange

attributes.name: options-cover
attributes.description: Expanded menu will cover the component (will not work along with 'use-input' prop for obvious reasons)

attributes.name: options-sanitize
attributes.description: Force use of textContent instead of innerHTML to render options; Use it when the options might be unsafe (from user input); Does NOT apply when using 'option' slot!

attributes.name: popup-content-class
attributes.description:
Class definitions to be attributed to the popup content

Examples:
my-special-class

attributes.name: popup-content-style
attributes.description:
Style definitions to be attributed to the popup content

Examples:
background-color: #ff0000
:content-style="{ backgroundColor: '#ff0000' }"

attributes.name: use-input
attributes.description: Use an input tag where users can type

attributes.name: use-chips
attributes.description: Use QChip to show what is currently selected

attributes.name: fill-input
attributes.description: Fills the input with current value; Useful along with 'hide-selected'; Does NOT works along with 'multiple' selection

attributes.name: new-value-mode
attributes.description: Enables creation of new values and defines behavior when a new value is added: 'add' means it adds the value (even if possible duplicate), 'add-unique' adds only unique values, and 'toggle' adds or removes the value (based on if it exists or not already); When using this prop then listening for @new-value becomes optional (only to override the behavior defined by 'new-value-mode')

attributes.name: map-options
attributes.description: Try to map labels of model from 'options' Array; has a small performance penalty; If you are using emit-value you will probably need to use map-options to display the label text in the select field rather than the value;  Refer to the 'Affecting model' section above

attributes.name: emit-value
attributes.description: Update model with the value of the selected option instead of the whole option

attributes.name: input-debounce
attributes.description:
Debounce the input model update with an amount of milliseconds

Examples:
650

attributes.name: input-class
attributes.description:
Class definitions to be attributed to the underlying input tag

Examples:
my-special-class
:input-class="{ 'my-special-class': <condition> }"

attributes.name: input-style
attributes.description:
Style definitions to be attributed to the underlying input tag

Examples:
background-color: #ff0000
:input-style="{ backgroundColor: '#ff0000' }"

attributes.name: tabindex
attributes.description:
Tabindex HTML attribute value

Examples:
0
100

attributes.name: transition-show
attributes.description:
Transition when showing the menu/dialog; One of Quasar's embedded transitions

Examples:
fade
slide-down

attributes.name: transition-hide
attributes.description:
Transition when hiding the menu/dialog; One of Quasar's embedded transitions

Examples:
fade
slide-down

attributes.name: behavior
attributes.description: Overrides the default dynamic mode of showing as menu on desktop and dialog on mobiles

events.name: virtual-scroll

arguments.name: details
arguments.description: Object of properties on the new scroll position

events.description: Emitted when the virtual scroll occurs

events.name: clear

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: The previous value before clearing it

events.description: When using the 'clearable' property, this event is emitted when the clear icon is clicked

events.name: input
events.description: Emitted when the component needs to change the model; Is also used by v-model

events.name: remove
events.description: Emitted when an option is removed from selection

events.name: add
events.description: Emitted when an option is added to the selection

events.name: new-value

arguments.name: inputValue
arguments.description:
What the user typed

Examples:
phone

arguments.name: doneFn
arguments.description: Adds (optional) value to the model; Do not forget to call it after you validate the newly created value; Call it with no parameters if nothing should be added

events.description: Enables creation of new values; Emitted when a new value has been created; You can override 'new-value-mode' property with it

events.name: filter

arguments.name: inputValue
arguments.description:
What the user typed

Examples:
phone

arguments.name: doneFn
arguments.description: Supply a function which makes the necessary updates

arguments.name: abortFn
arguments.description: Call this function if something went wrong

events.description: Emitted when user wants to filter a value

events.name: filter-abort
events.description: Emitted when a filtering was aborted; Probably a new one was requested?

events.name: popup-show
events.description: Emitted when the select options menu or dialog is shown.

events.name: popup-hide
events.description: Emitted when the select options menu or dialog is hidden.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Field main content

slots.name: prepend
slots.description: Prepend inner field; Suggestions: QIcon, QBtn

slots.name: append
slots.description: Append to inner field; Suggestions: QIcon, QBtn

slots.name: before
slots.description: Prepend outer field; Suggestions: QIcon, QBtn

slots.name: after
slots.description: Append outer field; Suggestions: QIcon, QBtn

slots.name: error
slots.description: Slot for errors; Enabled only if 'bottom-slots' prop is used; Suggestion: <div>

slots.name: hint
slots.description: Slot for hint text; Enabled only if 'bottom-slots' prop is used; Suggestion: <div>

slots.name: counter
slots.description: Slot for counter text; Enabled only if 'bottom-slots' prop is used; Suggestion: <div>

slots.name: loading
slots.description: Override default spinner when component is in loading mode; Suggestion: spinners

slots.name: selected
slots.description: Override default selection slot; Suggestion: QChip

slots.name: before-options
slots.description: Template slot for the elements that should be rendered before the list of options

slots.name: after-options
slots.description: Template slot for the elements that should be rendered after the list of options

slots.name: no-option

vue-properties.description:
Input textfield value, if any (not QSelect model)

typed something

slots.description: What should the menu display after filtering options and none are left to be displayed; Suggestion: <div>

vue-properties.description: Selected option -- its value is taken from model

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
Model of the component defining the split ratio percent (0.0 < x < 100.0) between panels; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'input' event) OR use v-model directive

Examples:
v-model="ratio"

attributes.name: reverse
attributes.description: Apply the model size to the second panel (by default it applies to the first)

attributes.name: unit
attributes.description: CSS unit for the model

attributes.name: horizontal
attributes.description: Allows the splitter to split its two panels horizontally, instead of vertically

attributes.name: limits
attributes.description:
An array of two values representing the minimum and maximum split size of the two panels; When 'px' unit is set then you can use Infinity as the second value to make it unbound on the other side

Examples:
:limits="[30, 70]"
:limits="[0, Infinity]"

attributes.name: disable
attributes.description: Put component in disabled mode

attributes.description:

attributes.name: after-class
attributes.description:
Class definitions to be attributed to the 'after' panel

Examples:

attributes.name: separator-class
attributes.description:
Class definitions to be attributed to the splitter separator

Examples:

:separator-class="{ 'my-special-class': <condition> }"

attributes.name: separator-style
attributes.description:
Style definitions to be attributed to the splitter separator

Examples:

:separator-style="{ backgroundColor: '#ff0000' }"

attributes.name: dark
attributes.description: Applies a default lighter color on the separator; To be used when background is darker; Avoid using when you are overriding through separator-class or separator-style props

attributes.description:
Rows of data to display

Examples:
:data="myData"

attributes.name: row-key
attributes.description:
Property of each row that defines the unique key of each row (the result must be a primitive, not Object, Array, etc); The value of property must be string or a function taking a row and returning the desired (nested) key in the row; If supplying a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
row-key="name"
:row-key="row => row.name"

attributes.name: virtual-scroll
attributes.description: Display data using QVirtualScroll (for non-grid mode only)

attributes.name: virtual-scroll-slice-size
attributes.description:
Number of rows to render in the virtual list

Examples:
:virtual-scroll-slice-size="60"

attributes.name: virtual-scroll-item-size
attributes.description:
Default size in pixels of a row; This value is used for rendering the initial table; Try to use a value close to the minimum size of a row

Examples:
:virtual-scroll-item-size="48"

attributes.name: virtual-scroll-sticky-size-start
attributes.description:
Size in pixels of the sticky header (if using one); A correct value will improve scroll precision

Examples:
:virtual-scroll-sticky-size-start="48"

attributes.name: virtual-scroll-sticky-size-end
attributes.description:
Size in pixels of the sticky footer part (if using one); A correct value will improve scroll precision

Examples:
:virtual-scroll-sticky-size-end="48"

attributes.name: factory
attributes.description: Function which should return an Object or a Promise resolving with an Object; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

attributes.name: url
attributes.description:
URL or path to the server which handles the upload. Takes String or factory function, which returns String. Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
https://example.com/path
files => `https://example.com?count=${files.length}`

attributes.name: method
attributes.description:
HTTP method to use for upload; Takes String or factory function which returns a String; Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
POST
:method="files => files.length > 10 ? 'POST' : 'PUT'"

attributes.name: field-name
attributes.description:
Field name for each file upload; This goes into the following header: 'Content-Disposition: form-data; name="__HERE__"; filename="somefile.png"; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
backgroundFile
:field-name="(file) => 'background' + file.name"

attributes.name: headers
attributes.description:
Array or a factory function which returns an array; Array consists of objects with header definitions; Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
[{name: 'Content-Type', value: 'application/json'}, {name: 'Accept', value: 'application/json'}]
() => [{name: 'X-Custom-Timestamp', value: Date.now()}]
files => [{name: 'X-Custom-Count', value: files.length}]

attributes.name: form-fields
attributes.description:
Array or a factory function which returns an array; Array consists of objects with additional fields definitions (used by Form to be uploaded); Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
[{name: 'my-field', value: 'my-value'}]
() => [{name: 'my-field', value: 'my-value'}]
files => [{name: 'my-field', value: 'my-value' + files.length}]

attributes.name: with-credentials
attributes.description:
Sets withCredentials to true on the XHR that manages the upload; Takes boolean or factory function for Boolean; Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
with-credentials
:with-credentials="files => ..."

attributes.name: send-raw
attributes.description:
Send raw files without wrapping into a Form(); Takes boolean or factory function for Boolean; Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
send-raw
:send-raw="files => ..."

attributes.name: batch
attributes.description:
Upload files in batch (in one XHR request); Takes boolean or factory function for Boolean; Function is called right before upload; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
files => files.length > 10

Size in pixels (height if vertical, width if horizontal) of the sticky part (if using one) at the start of the list; A correct value will improve scroll precision

Examples:
:virtual-scroll-sticky-size-start="48"

attributes.name: virtual-scroll-sticky-size-end
attributes.description:
Size in pixels (height if vertical, width if horizontal) of the sticky part (if using one) at the end of the list; A correct value will improve scroll precision

Examples:
:virtual-scroll-sticky-size-end="48"

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of content: list (default) or table

attributes.name: items
attributes.description:
Available list items that will be passed to the scoped slot; For best performance freeze the list of items; Required if 'itemsFn' is not supplied

Examples:
:items="[ 'BMW', 'Samsung Phone' ]"
:items="[ { label: 'BMW', value: 'car' }, { label: 'Samsung Phone', value: 'phone' } ]"

attributes.name: items-size
attributes.description:
Number of available items in the list; Required and used only if 'itemsFn' is provided

Examples:
:items-size="100000"
:items-size="500"

attributes.name: items-fn
attributes.description:
Function to return the scope for the items to be displayed; Should return an array for items starting from 'from' index for size length; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

Examples:
:items-fn="(from, size) => { const items = []; for (let i = 0; i < size; i++) { items.push('Item ' + i) }; return items }"

attributes.name: scroll-target
attributes.description:
CSS selector or DOM element to be used as scroll container instead of the component's own container

Examples:
:scroll-target="$refs.scrollTarget"
scroll-target="body"

events.name: virtual-scroll

arguments.name: details
arguments.description: Object of properties on the new scroll position

events.description: Emitted when the virtual scroll occurs

slots.name: before
slots.description: Template slot for the elements that should be rendered before the list; Suggestion: thead before a table

slots.name: after
slots.description: Template slot for the elements that should be rendered after the list; Suggestion: tfoot after a table

slots.name: default

vue-properties.name: index
vue-properties.description:
Item index in the options list

Examples:
0

vue-properties.name: item
vue-properties.description: Item data -- its value is taken from 'options' prop

slots.description: Template slot for defining the list item; Suggestion: QItem

vue-modifiers.name: subtree
vue-modifiers.description:
Extend monitoring to the entire subtree of nodes rooted at target

vue-modifiers.name: attributes
vue-modifiers.description:
Watch for changes to the value of attributes on the node or nodes being monitored

vue-modifiers.name: characterData
vue-modifiers.description:
Monitor the specified target node or subtree for changes to the character data contained within the node or nodes

Examples:

vue-modifiers.name: attributeOldValue
vue-modifiers.description:
Record the previous value of any attribute that changes when monitoring the node or nodes for attribute changes

vue-modifiers.name: characterDataOldValue
vue-modifiers.description:
Record the previous value of a node's text whenever the text changes on nodes being monitored
